oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Trees
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Veterans; Hardin County (Tenn.); Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thirty individuals taking part in a Civil War veterans reunion at Shiloh National Battlefield.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Shiloh National Military Park was established in 1894 and includes a large expanse of territory between Shiloh, Tennessee, and Corinth, Mississippi. The military park contains the Shiloh National Cemetery, the Shiloh Indian Mounds site, and numerous monuments to the various units and individuals who fought in this area during the American Civil War.
